properties.description: Roger II established an encampment at the town of Apice in 1130.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Prepared an Encampment at Crepacuore
properties.description: To strike Rainulf II and Robert II, Roger II prepares a camp at a town called Crepacuore.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Moved Encampment to Monteclavo
properties.description: Roger II changed the location of his encampment.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Moved Encampment to Paduli
properties.description: Roger II moves camp once more after hearing he would not be given passage through to Rome.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Robert II Made an Encampment at Castelpoto
properties.description: Preparing to aid the Beneventans, Robert II and Rainulf II place an encampment at the nearby town of Castelpoto.
properties.people:
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.description: Roger II camped outside the city of Trani.  Its citizens gave the city to him immediately, and its fortifications were destroyed.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Created an Encampment Between Morcone and Pontelandolfo
properties.description: Roger II created this encampment to bestow the lands of the Count of Boiano to Richard, son of Robert II.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Creaed an Encampment Outside Benevento
properties.description: Roger II moved his encampment outside of Benevento, earning the fealty of its populace.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Prince Robert II Pitched Camp at Ponte di Selice
properties.description: Instead of attacking Capua, Robert II encamped his soldiers.
properties.people:
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Emir John Brings an Army to Robert II
properties.description: Opposite the river bank of Robert II, Emir John pitched camp and began waiting out Robert's forces.
properties.people:
John, Emir
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Attack on the Suburbs of Naples
properties.description: Roger II encamped outside of Naples between the towns of Cuculo and Lago di Patria.  They razed their fields and suburbs.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Encampment at Paduli followed Roger's rest at Benevento
properties.description: While Roger II stopped at Benevento, his army was encamped at Paduli.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
